JobFullDesc: OverviewMicrosoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission. In this role, you will be supporting compensation-focused programs and initiatives and will assist with the development, communication, and execution of these programs in support of our Engineering and Research organizations.  ResponsibilitiesResponsibilitiesProgram Design & Adaptation - You identify the need for change based on external market, builds and communicates business case for new or changing compensation programs (e.g., promotions, stock awards, base pay, recognition, in-business programs), and facilitates the acceptance of the overall costs, principles, and impact of proposed changes with senior executives in partnership with HRBP. Program Design & Adaptation – You Lead compensation design and adaptation processes that synthesize market information. Interprets new/emerging legislation and industry trends. Anticipates and considers business needs while ensuring cross-program alignment. Gains support from leadership for an in-business compensation program (e.g., a specific local program) by partnering with HRBP. Identifying resources required and applying best practices. Program Implementation – You act as a thought leader for all things compensation for business HR teams across Engineering and Research space. Coaches and suggests modifications to implement project plans developed by their teams. Provides guidance and supports key compensation activities that are led by HRBP (e.g., special stock, rewards, in-business programs, etc.)Program Management – Drives complex, high-risk projects. Consults and partners with business HR teams as a subject matter expert to advise on compensation programs and processes, resolves intricate compensation issues and makes recommendations to improvie processes.Program Management – Leads short-term compensation solutions (e.g., in-business targeted compensation programs) and recommends long-term solutions to meet business needs. Identifies ways to improve compensation processes and enhance policy execution.  Organizes/executes informational presentations for diverse audiences (e.g., function/division leadership) in partnership with HRBP.Compensation Education & Consultation – Independently handles the most complex compensation questions (e.g., Tier IV escalations) from internal executive clients (e.g., Senior Leadership Team) and delivers solutions, often in ambiguous or unusual circumstances. Coaches internal partners on compensation-related decisions, including regulatory implications and mitigation strategies.QualificationsQualificationsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesProject Management - Knowledge of and the ability to independently carry out the process of planning, organizing, and managing tasks and resources to accomplish a well defined objective. This includes the ability to manage and provide project deliverables, optimize the contribution of the people involved, and assess the impact of project decisions on quality, productivity, schedules, cost, performance, etc.Business Acumen - The ability to deeply understand the parts of the business and their interrelationships. This includes skill in understanding the industry, competition, and expected future developments and challenges, the business's competitive strengths and weaknesses, opportunities to grow the business and reduce operating costs; and awareness of the environment for opportunities.Consulting - The skill to influence others, develop and maintain working relationships, and deliver results and/or expertise for a client in a professional manner.Compensation Analysis - The ability to conduct complex compensation analysis. This includes the abilty to gather and interpret compensation data, identify implications of data, draw conclusions, generate alternatives and solutions, and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative using quality metrics and data. This includes the ability to convert general data and findings into applied, specific information and suggestions that add value to business planning and strategies.Compensation Trends - The ability to stay abreast of compensation trends in the marketplace including competitor practices as well as the ability to analyze compensation and job data that exhibits an ongoing pattern. This includes the ability to forecast future compensation issues and demands.Required/Minimum Qualifications6+ years of directly related compensation work experience OR 7+ years of general HR experience or other related work experience OR Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business or related field with 5+ years of related work experience Additional or Preferred Qualifications7+ years of directly related compensation work experience AND Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business or related fieldCompensation project management experienceCompensation program design experience  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
